author: djames

author: jerenkrantz
msg: ra_serf: Handle binary properties correctly by always storing svn_string_t's in
our property hash and be stricter about the types in our property hash.
Passes prop test #13 (test binary property support).
(proppatch_walker): Update argument types; return svn_error_t; send correct
Update argument types; return svn_error_t; for the setters, don't create an
svn_string_t as we already did that earlier.
(end_report): If we have a binary prop, decode it; use memdup instead of
strmemdup (embedded null's!) to copy the new value; place a string in
(svn_ra_serf__get_ver_prop): Update return type and make this a stub around...
(svn_ra_serf__set_ver_prop): Take a string, don't do strlen's; and copy any
newly created hash keys into our new pool;
(end_propfind): Ensure our len is set if we're a 'fake' prop; decode
binary properties; ensure our session cache is of the right lifetime;
clear encoding value after each iteration.
(dirent_walker): Update argument types; return svn_error_t; val is now a
svn_error_t and take specific types instead of void's.
(svn_ra_serf__get_ver_prop_string): New function which returns a string.
